description: Number of unitary and squarefree divisors of n! Also, number of divisors of the special squarefree part of n!, A055773(n).
comments: The divisor d=1 is counted here as being free of prime divisors and also unitary.
example: n=11, 11!=2.2.2.2.2.2.2.2.3.3.3.3.5.5.7.11, has 540 divisors, 32 are unitary and 32 are squarefree. Only 4 divisors, {1,7,11,77} have both properties, so a(11)=4.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Aug 10 2000
